Service Details: - Provides specialized mental health services to youth who are in conflict with the law- Services include court-ordered assessments of youth residing in the community, assessments or consultations of youth referred by a youth probation officer, general and specialized mental health services for youth in the community or remanded or sentenced to custody, specialized outpatient programs dealing with sexual and violent offenses, and community treatment and supervision of youth with a conditional discharge from the BC Board of Review
Eligibility: Ages: 12 year(s) - 17 year(s)Youth aged 12 - 17 at the time of the offence, involved with the youth criminal justice system, required by court order to attend for assessment or treatment, and in need of services for mental health or behaviour problems.
How to Apply: - Requires direct referrals from youth justice courts, youth probation officers and youth custody centres- Please call our outpatient clinic for further information or general enquires
